entry.title: Error when doing POST in custom Fiori Application
entry.content:
I have implemented an Odata v4 service which is created in /iwbep/v4_admin/, /iwfnd/v4_admin on my custom Fiori app.
But upon trying to do a POST method, I encountered this issue:

"POST on 'Z_CDSTEST' failed; will be repeated automatically - Error Provider application did not request execution details ..."

entry.title: Missing Graphical Progress of Operations in "Manage Production Orders" Fiori App After S/4HANA Upgra
entry.content:
Hello Community,
After our recent upgrade to S/4HANA 2023, we‚Äôve noticed that the graphical information on  progress of operation bar is missing in the "Manage Production Orders" Fiori app. Previously, we could easily see the information on progress of  operation visually, but now this feature seems to be unavailable or not displaying as expected.

Before

After

What are the best practices to verify and restore such features?

Any guidance, documentation, or experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance.

Nitin

entry.title: ReferenceError: sap is not defined
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

our pipeline is failing with below error in the karma step 

as we are using piper template to run our pipeline we are using KarmaExecutetests step

when we are the tests in local it is running fine but when we run in the pipeline it failing with below error

Chrome Headless 139.0.0.0 (Linux 0.0.0) ERROR
info karmaExecuteTests - Uncaught ReferenceError: sap is not defined
info karmaExecuteTests - at webapp/test/unit/unitTests.qunit.js:1:1
info karmaExecuteTests -
info karmaExecuteTests - ReferenceError: sap is not defined
info karmaExecuteTests - at webapp/test/unit/unitTests.qunit.js:1:1

please find the logs for better understanding attached
below is unittest.qunit.html file
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<head>
	<title>Unit tests</title>
	<meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=edge'>
	<meta charset="utf-8">

	<script 
		id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
		src="../../../../resources/sap-ui-core.js"
		data-sap-ui-libs="sap.m"
		data-sap-ui-resourceroots='{
			"exemptiontool.exemptiontool": "../../",
			"test/unit": "./"
		}'>
		</script>

	<script src="../../../../resources/sap/ui/qunit/qunit-css.js"></script>
	<script src="../../../../resources/sap/ui/thirdparty/qunit.js"></script>
	<script src="../../../../resources/sap/ui/qunit/qunit-junit.js"></script>
	<script src="../../../../resources/sap/ui/qunit/qunit-coverage.js"></script>

	<script>
		QUnit.config.autostart = false;

		sap.ui.require(
			["test/unit/allTests"],
			function () {
				QUnit.start();
			}
		);
	</script>

</head>

<body>
	<ol id="qunit-tests"></ol>
	<div id="qunit-fixture"></div>
</body>

</html>

below is opa5.qunit.html

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Integration tests</title>
    <meta charset="utf-8">

    <script id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
            src="../../../../resources/sap-ui-core.js"
            data-sap-ui-theme='sap_fiori_3'

                "exemptiontool.exemptiontool": "../../"
            }'
            data-sap-ui-animation="false"

    <script src="opaTests.qunit.js"></script>

</head>
<body>
    <div id="qunit"></div>
    <div id="qunit-fixture"></div>
</body>
</html>


could you please help me here
Best Regards,
Bhanu.

entry.title: How to access and test an extended Fiori app created with Adaptation Project in BAS?
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

I‚Äôm seeking your guidance to understand what steps I need to follow to properly access an extended Fiori app. Let me explain the context:

This week, we extended the standard app ‚ÄúManage Central Purchase Contracts‚Äù using an Adaptation Project in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

I had previously done similar extensions using SAP Web IDE, so I assumed the process would be similar. However, I found some differences and a few doubts that I hope you can help me clarify.

After deploying the app to our system, I noticed that the transport request included the following objects, which I hadn‚Äôt seen before:

  • App Variant (LRep cross-client content)

  • LRepository cross-client content

My main question is that I don‚Äôt know where the new app is located or how to verify that the changes were applied correctly.
Do I need any specific role or authorization to access it?

I‚Äôd also like to confirm whether it‚Äôs necessary to configure a Fiori Launchpad tile or perform any additional setup to make the extended app available.
If so, where should I look or what objects should I check?

Lastly, due to client security policies, I must request and justify access to specific transactions. I already have the basic Fiori ones, but I‚Äôd like to know if there are any additional transactions I should request to complete the setup.

Apologies for the number of questions, but this is my first time extending a standard Fiori app from BAS (we usually work with Custom or Fiori Elements apps).

Thank you very much in advance for your help and guidance!

Edson Bravo.

entry.title: Sap Fiori My Inbox Task Priorty
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I have an app called My Inbox in Fiori. There's a task ranking there. I was asked to hide the area labeled "medium." I found a badi and by debugging it, I discovered that the "medium" text appears in the code block below. But I can't edit it. How can I fix this problem?

This Badi:

/IWPGW/BADI_TGW_TASK_DATA-MODIFY_TASK_TITLE

The data sent to this badi comes from the following method.

The text field I want to remove is displayed on the line below this method. However, when I click inside it, nothing appears; only a single line of data appears.

How can I intervene here? I've been struggling with this issue for a week and haven't found a solution. Please help me. If I'm looking in the wrong places, let me know.

entry.title: How to Create Data via BOI from Custom SAPUI5 App in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm working on an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud scenario where I need to create new data (entity instances) from a custom SAPUI5 application.
The app is already deployed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad and is consuming an OData service that I exposed through ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse. This OData service is based on a custom CDS view.

Now, I want to perform create operations ‚Äî for example, creating a Production Order Confirmation.
I found the following Business Object Interface (BOI) on the SAP API Business Hub:
üëâ I_PRODUCTIONORDCONFIRMATIONTP

However, I‚Äôm not sure about the best practice for implementing this BOI interface in the Public Cloud environment:

  • Should I create a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) behavior definition that consumes the BOI interface?

  • Or is there another recommended integration pattern for invoking BOIs from a custom application?

  • How can I trigger the BOI create operation from my custom UI5 app (which currently consumes only my custom CDS service)?

I‚Äôd appreciate any guidance, examples, or references on how to correctly implement a BOI-based data creation scenario in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Thank you in advance!
Tadeas

Thank you for your help!

entry.title: How to get a list of standard Fiori applications that are extended in the system?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement to identify if any standard SAP Fiori applications in our system have been extended or enhanced.

Is there any  way to get a list of standard Fiori apps that have been extended in S/4HANA?

We are looking for a reliable method to check which standard apps have been customized, either on the frontend or backend side.

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Silent Login of Fiori/UI5 Application
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am currently working with the Fiori/UI5 application that is registered as the mashup in FSM. FSM and Workzone use the same CIS and SSO is enabled. That leads to the fact that when I open a browser, login to FSM and get to my mashup, the application is loaded perfectly.

On the other hand if I close the browser and re-open it, then navigate to FSM - I am automatically logged in since cookie/token is saved. But I can not get my application loaded - the login cookie is not passed to the Workzone and application gets halted. I have to logout manually from FSM and login back to activate the login token and make the application work again.

Is there any mechanism or approach that will help the cookie be passed after I re-open browser and FSM without logging out?

Any help or advise would be really appreciated!

Br,
Aleks.

entry.title: Prevent approval/rejection of forwarded workflow task when user lacks required profiles
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have a requirement to prevent users who received a forwarded workflow task in My Inbox from approving or rejecting the task if they do not have the required authorization profiles.

To achieve this, we implemented the BAdI /IWWRK/IF_WF_WI_BEFORE_UPD_IB.
Our logic works correctly in principle ‚Äî it checks the user‚Äôs profiles and returns an error message in CT_RETURN if the authorization is missing. However, the task still gets completed regardless of the error message.

We have noticed that there are standard SAP implementations of this BAdI which already execute the work item before our implementation is called. As a result, even when we return an error message, the action still goes through and the work item is disappears from the inbox.

Question:

Is there a supported way to prevent or cancel the work item execution if our custom implementation detects missing authorization? Or is there a more appropriate BAdI or method (for flexible workflows) where such pre-checks can be implemented?

Any guidance or experience from others who have handled similar requirements would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Anouk

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE: For Supplier Invoice workflow tasks this can be resolved following the correction instructions of SAP note 3612336. However, as far as I know there is no solution yet for other workflow scenarios.

entry.title: How to restrict editing of fields like UOM, weight, and volume in Fiori Manage Product Master Data?
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I have a requirement to restrict editing of certain fields such as Unit of Measure (UOM), weight, and volume in the SAP Fiori Manage Product Master Data tile. These fields should be visible but not editable to users for data consistency and control purposes.

Currently, I am exploring various possibilities including:

  • Using UI adaptation/runtime authoring to make these fields read-only

  • Setting authorization roles and restrictions

  • Extending OData services or adding validations on the backend

Could you please share best practices or known solutions to achieve this? Is there any standard way or recommended approach within SAP S/4HANA and Fiori to restrict these specific fields on the product master data app?
SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database  SAP BTP ABAP environment Security NW ABAP User Administration and Authorization SAP BTP Security field masking for Web Client UI

entry.title: Adapt UI on SAP Fiori app RAP deployed on Cloud Foundry
entry.content:
Hi guys, my backend is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.SAP Fiori

We developed a RAP application embedded in Public Cloud, and a Fiori frontend on BTP deployed on Cloud Foundry.

Now the user wants to save variants of this app ‚Äî default values, hidden fields, etc. Basically, they want the Adapt UI functionality that exists in S/4HANA Public Cloud, but for apps deployed on Cloud Foundry and running in Work Zone.

Is this possible?

entry.title: SAP UI5 input control does not autofill google password manager credentials
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In my custom sap ui5 application, I have a Simple form in a Dialog which takes user name as input and password as input

For the first time, user fills in the credentials which we can save with google password manager.

Next time when we open the app, the username and password fields are autofilled when the dialog is opened., which is expected.

Now when we try to open this app in a new tab by cross app navigation, the autofill does not work.

On focusing the password field, it shows user/password saved suggestion on click of which only password field is filled. But username needs to be entered manually.

Following is the snippet of fragment used in Dialog:

This is how it looks and autofill works in same tab:

While when same app opened in new tab, autofill does not work:

On inspecting the input field:

autocomplete is off, not sure if it makes a difference.

Any suggestions on how to make it work seamlessly if we open the app in new tab?

Thanks and Regards,

Sugandha

entry.title: Fiori SAML integration with Azure Entra ID
entry.content:
We are currently working on enabling the SAP application for external access. However, we have encountered an issue with SAML integration when using the external Fiori URL.

The integration functions works fine with the internal SAP URL, where all traffic routes through the VPC. For example, the internal URL is https://hostname:XXXXX/sap/saml2/sp/acs/210.

When using the external Fiori URL (for users not connected to our VPC), I encounter an issue post-authentication. The SAP page displays the message, "Our service is not available at the moment. Please try again later." I suspect the load balancer is not correctly transferring information to the SAP application server

Do we need open port externally for  SAP application server? how is the load balancer handles the SAML request? Appreciate your thoughts

URL, https://Fioridev.XX.XX.ondemand.com/sap/saml2/sp/acs/210

thanks

entry.title: Can not view of Debit Memo Request Details in My Inbox App
entry.content:

I would like to know if there is any SAP Note or a solution available that can be implemented to enable a similar details overview functionality for Debit Memo Requests in the My Inbox app.

Your guidance or suggestions on how to achieve this would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help!
